result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David W Horounziak

records.addlTxt: Case set for a plea and sentencing hearing on 11/1/22. Defense counsel requests an adjournment. Case is rescheduled to 12/16/22 at 10:30 am. Parties notified via email.

Defendant David W Horounziak not in court.  Attorney Andrew Joel Golden in court for David W Horounziak.  Attorney Mallory R Davis in court for State of Wisconsin. 
MATTER HEARD OFF THE RECORD. Court is in trial and unable to hear the matter. Case is adjourned for a plea and sentencing hearing in Branch 29.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Plea Questionnaire Waiver of Rights and Addendum, filed.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, filed.

Defendant David W Horounziak in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling conference held.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Defense counsel requests a plea and sentencing hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Case set for a review hearin gon 7/6/22 at 1:30 pm. State requests an adjournment and matter is rescheduled for 7/7/22 at 9:30 am. Parties notified via email.

Defendant David W Horounziak in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Status conference held.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Defense counsel has discovery and requests a scheduling conference.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

CASE HEARD IN BR 37 FOR BR 29. Defendant David W Horounziak in court.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  David W Horounziak appeared by video means.  Deputy Court Clerk: MK.  HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST.  Case in court for indigency hearing.  
Defendant does not qualify for public defender representation  Indigency Hearing held. 
Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by the court.  
Defendant agreed to repay Milwaukee County for the fees and expense paid by Milwaukee County. 
The court appointed Attorney Andrew Golden to represent defendant  at County expense  at the rate of $100.00 per hour. Attorney Golden joined the Zoom meeting. Attorney Golden accepted the appointment of counsel.
Defendant repay the County at a rate of $20.00 Per Month. Repayment to begin 1/1/2023 and on the first of each month until paid in full. Defendant advised failure to pay will result in a Civil Judgment 
Court ordered matter adjourned for Status Conference. 
Case remains calendared in Branch 29.  Status conference scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Oral No Contact Order with DWM.

Defendant David W Horounziak in court.  Sara Beth Hill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was not interviewed by the public defender's office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible.  
The case is adjourned for a Indigency Hearing in Br. 29.  Indigency hearing scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 4/6/22 @ 2:30p
